greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Factored over the Gaussian integers, n has a(n) distinct prime factors, including units -1, i, and -i.
comment: Here -1, i, and -i are counted as factors. The factor 1 is counted only in a(1).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(3) = 1 because 3 is prime over the complex numbers.
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Mar 31 2014
